intro: Cremanthodium laciniatum, commonly known as the shredded rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of a fern, giving it a distinctive, almost lacy appearance. Cremanthodium laciniatum is a perennial herb that thrives in sunny, well-drained habitats.
